thread.title: Regional jets, planes buzzed by drones
thread.title_full: Regional jets, planes buzzed by drones

author: The Associated Press
title: Regional jets, planes buzzed by drones
text:
On Friday, Delta Flight 407 was about 1,400 feet off the ground when its pilot spotted an unmanned aircraft. 
Both planes landed safely. 
The pilot of a small plane had to make a sharp turn to avoid a drone over southern New Jersey. The FAA told Philadelphia's WCAU-TV that the pilot of the Piper PA28 spotted the drone when he was about 1,000 feet over Washington Township, Gloucester County, on Sunday. 
The pilot said he was forced to make an evasive turn to avoid hitting the drone. 
FAA rules don't permit unmanned objects above 400 feet. 
U.S. Sen. Charles Schumer, D-N.Y., called on the FAA to implement so-called geofencing. He said it would enable drone-makers to program the devices to be unable to fly within 2 miles of any airport, above 500 feet and near any sensitive positions.
